events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred at an intersection, causing front bumper and headlight damage.
After initial review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal car in a collision.
Assigned claims agent contacted the insured promptly to guide through the claims process and answer questions.
Official acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the insured, confirming receipt and next steps for processing.
Requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and repair estimates to proceed with claim.
The insured promptly submitted all requested documents, including detailed repair quotes and the official police report.
Investigation began to verify claim details, damage extent, and circumstances surrounding the vehicle collision.
Investigation confirmed the insured’s account was accurate; damage estimated and fault assessment completed.
A settlement amount was proposed to the insured based on verified repair costs and policy coverage limits.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the clear communication and timely handling of their auto accident claim.
Final approval was granted after review of all submitted documents and confirmation of coverage eligibility.
Payment for the approved vehicle repairs was issued to the insured’s designated bank account successfully.
The claim was formally closed following issuance of payment and confirmation of claimant's satisfaction.
All claim records including documents, investigation notes, and correspondence were securely archived.
